properties.name: Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by HannahalyssaParis, FranceThe Eiffel Tower located in Paris, France was built in May of 1889. It was built to celebrate the great strides that had been made in engineering and science. The Eiffel Tower was known as the worlds tallest building until around forty years later the Empire State was built. There are 2731 steps to the top of the tower, and it wieghs 7000 tons. The names of 72 french scientists are written just beneath the first platform. They are hard to notice in photographs, but can be seen clearly in person.

properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by HannahalyssaChinaThe Great Wall of China was first constructed to keep Mongol nomads out. The first set of walls were built of earth and stone. However, its purpose was defeated and the Mongols were still able to get into China. This is because the Great Wall is not continuous, but actually several short walls that follow the southern edge of the Mongolian plain. In Chinese the wall is actually referred to as "Wan-Li Qang-Qeng. It is made of masonry, rocks, and packed earth. Its over 5000 kilometers long, and reaches about twenty five feet in height.

properties.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
properties.description: Posted by HannahalyssaPisa, ItalyThe Leaning Tower of Pisa is a bell tower located in Pisa, Italy. Its famous for leaning 4.4 meters out starting at the seventh story. Although it was built to stand straight, it began leaning while still in construction in August 1173. Its tilt was due to an unstable foundation, and it began to sink after just three stories were built. The construction started in 1173 and took two whole centuries to complete. The tower today stands at 55 meters.

properties.name: Taj mahal
properties.description: Posted by HannahalyssaIndia

properties.name: Taj mahal
properties.description: Posted by HannahalyssaIndiaThe Taj Mahal is considered to be one of the world wonders. It is also considered to be one of the most exquisite monuments built by the Mughals, or the Muslim rulers of India. It was built by emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife wife Mumtaz Mahal. It was constructed over a period of twenty-two years, and it took twenty thousand workers to complete it. Its central dome is fifty-eight feet in diameter and rises to a height of 213 feet.

properties.name: castello sforzesco
properties.description: Posted by Hannahalyssamilan, italyThe Castello Sforzesco is a castle located in downtown Milan. The castle was built in the 14th century only to be destoryed several times by invaders and the Milanese themselves. However, in 1450, Fransesco Sforza became Duke of Milan and rebuilt the castle once and for all. This amazing castle has all the characteristics of a eral castle. There are moats, drawing bridges, and towers.

properties.name: empire state building
properties.description: Posted by Hannahalyssanew york city, new yorkThe Empire State Building is a national icon all over the United States. It was opened on May 1,1931, where it became the tallest building ever. This gigantic building was constructed in order to beat the Eiffel Tower which was originally the tallest building at 984 feet. The United States rose to the challenge of out doing Paris. It was a fierce competition. People from all over began trying to extend their buildings higher and higher. However, in the end The Empire State in New York City, New York proved to win at an astronomical 1250 feet.

properties.name: golden gate bridge
properties.description: Posted by Hannahalyssasan fransisco, californiaMay 27,1937 was the date the Golden Gate Bridge was first open to pedestrians. The Bridge was the longest in the world until the Verrazano Bridge was built in New York in 1964. However, it still has the seventh longest main span in the World. Its total length is 8,981 feet, and it has a ninety feet width. Its total weight today is around 804,700,000 kg. About forty million cars cross the bridge per year.

properties.name: golden gate bridge
properties.description: Posted by Hannahalyssasan fransisco, californiaThe golden gate bridge is a suspension bridge. It is three miles long and the color is international orange. It is very well known all over the United States. Its the entrance to the Sanfransisco Bay. It had two towers that are taller than the Washington Monument.

properties.name: metropolitan cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Hannahalyssasanta cruz, boliviaThe Metropolitan Cathedral was built in 1810, where it used to be a college for Jesuits. The cathedral is known for its custom wooden vaults with intricate pictorial decorations. It is said to have been built by Mercedario Frey Diego De Porres.

properties.name: panama canal
properties.description: Posted by HannahalyssapanamaThe Panama Canal is owned and administrated by the Republic of Panama. It connects the Atlantic and Pacific oceans through the Ithsmus of Panama. The Suez and Panama Canal are the two most strategic artificial waterways in the world. Because of the Panama Canal ships can sometimes save as much as 3700 kilometers. Certain ships cannot pass through the canal at designated places because it changes in sizes as it goes.

properties.name: park guell
properties.description: Posted by Hannahalyssabarcelona, spainThis famous park today located in Barcelona, Spain, began as a plan by Antonio Gaudi, to build a city garden with family residences located nearby. However, the plan fell through and instead the area was created into a public park. The park is entered by a large stairway, and there are 86 massive columns within. There is a large balcony overlooking the Barcelona Sea, and multiple statues and sculptures. There are colorful murals and paintings located all through out and there are numerous breathtaking views.
